title: How a Long Government Shutdown Could Leave Scars on the Economy
summary: The effect is rippling beyond missing paychecks to federal services that support much of the economy.

title: No Education Department? No Problem, Trump’s Education Secretary Says.
summary: The shutdown means there is, essentially, no Education Department. The latest round of layoffs would leave few workers to enforce special education and civil rights laws.

title: What Could Torpedo the Stock Rally
summary: The S&P 500 is nearing another record, but some analysts caution that a host of factors may stall its momentum.

title: Judges Warn of ‘Judicial Crisis,’ and Universities Reject Trump Offer
summary: Plus, a drastic drop in peanut allergies.

title: Nations Hesitate to Send Troops to Gaza, Fearing Clashes With Hamas
summary: The Trump peace plan calls for an international security force in the Gaza Strip, but countries that might send troops are wary of danger, an unclear mission and being seen as occupiers.

title: Vance Lands in Israel as U.S. Tries to Shore Up Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
summary: With the cease-fire deal under strain, Vice President JD Vance is set to meet with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other leaders.

title: G.O.P. Senators Oppose Trump Watchdog Nominee After Report of Racist Texts
summary: At least four Republican senators, including the Senate majority leader, signaled their opposition to Paul Ingrassia, the president’s pick to lead the Office of Special Counsel.

title: White House’s East Wing Partially Demolished to Build Trump’s Ballroom
summary: The president had pledged that construction wouldn’t “interfere with the current building,” a promise that always seemed unrealistic given the grand scale of the plans.

title: China Has Another Lever to Pull in Showdown With Trump: Factory Lines
summary: In Washington, China hawks say its economy is too weak to withstand a tariff shock. In the city of Yiwu, factories are showing why, for now, that may be a miscalculation.

title: Tariffs Are Reshaping China’s Trade. This Tanzanian Sees an Opportunity.
summary: An interview with a 26-year-old entrepreneur, who has taken seven trips to China to buy handbags, clothes and jewelry. “China is the center of everything,” she said.

title: Can a U.S.-Australia Deal on Rare Earths Counter China’s Dominance?
summary: Australia’s got reserves and mining expertise, and the United States is eager to invest in alternatives to China. But building mines, refineries and factories could take years.

title: I Went on a ‘Dark Retreat’ and Spent Three Days in Total Darkness
summary: The author spent days in a room with no light. Who would he be when he emerged?

title: Louvre Robbery Raises Questions About Security
summary: Investigators were looking into the alarm systems at an institution that one expert said “wasn’t built with an obsession over security.”

title: Russia Pushes a State-Controlled ‘Super App’ by Sabotaging Its Rivals
summary: As the Kremlin throttles WhatsApp and Telegram, the new MAX messaging app is moving Russia closer to a restricted internet without foreign technology.

title: More Than 100 Cases of Measles Reported in Utah and Arizona
summary: In the hardest-hit counties, childhood vaccination rates steeply declined during the pandemic.

title: Sanae Takaichi is Japan’s New Prime Minister, and She’s a Heavy Metal Drummer
summary: Sanae Takaichi, a fan of Iron Maiden, had an improbable rise to power. Like her mentor, Shinzo Abe, she is expected to lead Japan to the right.

title: Who Is Sanae Takaichi, Japan’s First Female Prime Minister?
summary: The hard-line conservative is making history in a country where women are drastically underrepresented at the highest levels of power.

title: Grace Wales Bonner Is Named Creative Director of Men’s Wear at Hermès
summary: Grace Wales Bonner is the new creative director of men’s wear at the French fashion house.

title: Inside Amazon’s Plans to Replace Workers With Robots
summary: Internal documents show the company that changed how people shop has a far-reaching plan to automate 75 percent of its operations.

title: The Robots Fueling Amazon’s Automation
summary: Meet Sparrow, Cardinal and Proteus. They’re the robots that, step by step, are replacing human workers in the company’s warehouses.

title: Amazon’s AWS Disruption Creates Outages for Hundreds of Websites for Hours
summary: Amazon Web Services, a major provider of cloud services, cited a problem at its data center in Northern Virginia. The outage highlighted the fragility of global internet infrastructure.

title: Curtis Sliwa Has the Spotlight. He’s Not About to Give It Up.
summary: Mr. Sliwa, the Republican nominee for mayor of New York City, finds himself a major player in the race. He’s under heavy pressure to drop out.

title: Wolfgang Puck’s Spago Had Star Power in the ’80s. Does It Still Shine?
summary: The groundbreaking Beverly Hills power restaurant still draws crowds. But the food isn’t what it once was.

title: Trump’s Self-Inflicted Soybean Problem
summary: Tariffs don’t seem to be working as planned.

title: The Louvre Heist
summary: Today, we look at how thieves pulled off this weekend’s brazen daylight robbery in Paris and why they did it.

title: Late Night Revisits Ye Olde ‘No Kings’ Protests
summary: Jon Stewart consulted the Declaration of Independence’s king-inspired stipulations on “The Daily Show.”

title: France Sends Former President Nicolas Sarkozy to Prison to Start 5-Year Sentence
summary: Nicolas Sarkozy, the president of France from 2007 to 2012, received a five-year sentence after being convicted in a campaign finance scandal.

title: Guard Enraged by Chaos at Jail Chased and Shot at Smugglers, U.S. Says
summary: Leon Wilson worked at the troubled Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn for decades. Prosecutors say he pursued suspects for five miles in a violent fury.

title: With Diwali Comes the Start of Air Pollution Season in New Delhi
summary: The air quality in India’s capital ranks among the worst in the world, but experts say politics stand in the way of improving it.

title: This Democrat Lost a Big Race. The Party Is Uneasy About His Return.
summary: Mandela Barnes, the former lieutenant governor of Wisconsin, lost a race for Senate in 2022. He is likely to run for governor in 2026, while Democrats are eager for new candidates and new ideas.
